repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits.

summary.p:
The codex, a composite manuscript, contains 3 items:
Elements of Tamil grammar in French (Indien 188a).
2 Tamil syllabaries (Indien 188b).
A grammar of Tamil language in Portuguese (Indien 188c).

supportDesc.foliation:
57 folios. Arabic library foliation 1-57 in black ink in the top right of rectos + 2 blank folios. Distributed as follows:
f1-f6 = Indien 188a: elements of Tamil grammar in French
f7 = Indien 188b: 2 Tamil syllabaries
f8-f57, f[58]-f[59] = Indien 188c: a grammar of Tamil language in Portuguese

collation.desc: 3 folios = guard leaves. Element of library binding.
3 folios = guard leaves. Element of library binding.

binding.p: Volume apparently bound in the BnF. No title on the spine.

origin.origDate: Dated to circa 1730 by Vinson (1888) and to 1730 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

acquisition.p: Items possibly sent in the 1730s by the Jesuits of the Pondicherry mission. Brought probably by Anquetil-Duperron according to Vinson (Petit 2014, p. 449).
